identificationModule.briefTitle: Functional Imaging in the Acute Phase of Transient Ischemic Attacks
identificationModule.officialTitle: Contribution of Functional Imaging to the Diagnostic and Assesment of the Acute Phase of Transient Ischemic Attacks : a Preliminary Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of the study is to find a radiological biomarker of Transient Ischemic Attacks (TIA) thanks to functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) done within the 24 hour after symptoms onset.

armGroups.label: Confirmed TIA
armGroups.description: Confirmed TIA at 3 months with standardized neurological expertise
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging

armGroups.label: Confirmed non-TIA
armGroups.description: Not-confirmed TIA at 3 months with standardized neurological expertise
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging

interventions.name: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging
interventions.description: fMRI sequences done with motor paradigm (right and left arm), followed by resting state acquisition

primaryOutcomes.description: BOLD effect differences in motor cortex from pathological side versus healthy side measured by fMRI within the 24 hours after symptom onset, during a motor paradigm

secondaryOutcomes.description: Bold effect differences in resting state networks from pathological side versus healthy side measured by fMRI within the 24 hours after symptom onset, during a motor paradigm

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient admitted in for a transient neurologic deficit and suspicion of TIA of carotid circulation
* Prescription for conventionnal MRI

Exclusion Criteria:

* Contraindication to MRI
* Previous neurological disease (with lesions)
* Severe psychiatric disease
